@graph.name: Vegetarian Breakfast Casserole - Vegan Heaven
@graph.description: This vegetarian breakfast casserole with BBQ tempeh "bacon" and potatoes is perfect for a hearty breakfast or even brunch. Delicious and super easy to make!

@graph.headline: Vegetarian Breakfast Casserole
@graph.keywords: hash browns breakfast casserole,hash browns casserole,hearty vegan breakfast,how to make vegan eggs,kala namak,tempeh bacon,vegan bacon,vegan breakfast,vegan breakfast casserole,vegan breakfast recipes,vegan egg,vegan egg recipes,vegan hash browns,vegetarian breakfast casserole,vegetarian breakfast casserole with hash browns

@graph.name: Vegetarian Breakfast Casserole
@graph.description: This vegetarian breakfast casserole with BBQ tempeh "bacon" and potatoes is perfect for a hearty breakfast or even brunch. Delicious and super easy to make!
recipeIngredient: 5 medium potatoes (about 22 oz.) (If you want it to be faster, you can also use store-bought southern style hash browns instead.)
1 tablespoon fresh or frozen chives, cut into rings
more vegan cheese to sprinkle on top

recipeInstructions.text: Boil the unpeeled potatoes for about 15-20 minutes or until they're tender. Peel and cut them into cubes.
recipeInstructions.name: Boil the unpeeled potatoes for about 15-20 minutes or until they're tender. Peel and cut them into cubes.

recipeInstructions.text: While the potatoes are boiling, make the BBQ tempeh "bacon": Cut the tempeh into small cubes. Heat some more oil in the pan you used for the potatoes and cook the remaining onions for about a minute. Add the tempeh and stir in the BBQ sauce, the paprika powder, the soy sauce, and if using the liquid smoke. Season with salt and pepper and cook for about 5 minutes. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: While the potatoes are boiling, make the BBQ tempeh "bacon": Cut the tempeh into small cubes. Heat some more oil in the pan you used for the potatoes and cook the remaining onions for about a minute. Add the tempeh and stir in the BBQ sauce, the paprika powder, the soy sauce, and if using the liquid smoke. Season with salt and pepper and cook for about 5 minutes. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat some oil in a large pan and cook about half of the chopped onions for about 2 minutes or until translucent. Add the potatoes and season with paprika powder, salt, and pepper. Cook for about 5 minutes or until crispy and lightly brown. Set aside. If you want the recipe to be a bit quicker, you can also use store-bought southern style hash browns.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat some oil in a large pan and cook about half of the chopped onions for about 2 minutes or until translucent. Add the potatoes and season with paprika powder, salt, and pepper. Cook for about 5 minutes or until crispy and lightly brown. Set aside. If you want the recipe to be a bit quicker, you can also use store-bought southern style hash browns.

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, combine the silken tofu, the oil, the starch, the turmeric, the paprika powder and the kala namak. Whisk until smooth. Stir in the vegan cheese and the chives.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium bowl, combine the silken tofu, the oil, the starch, the turmeric, the paprika powder and the kala namak. Whisk until smooth. Stir in the vegan cheese and the chives.

recipeInstructions.text: Fill the potatoes and the BBQ tempeh into a casserole dish and stir in the vegan egg-cheese mixture. Sprinkle with some more vegan cheese and bake for 15-20 minutes at 350 °F.
recipeInstructions.name: Fill the potatoes and the BBQ tempeh into a casserole dish and stir in the vegan egg-cheese mixture. Sprinkle with some more vegan cheese and bake for 15-20 minutes at 350 °F.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve with fresh chives, parsley, and cherry tomatoes.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve with fresh chives, parsley, and cherry tomatoes.
